--- title: "Jesús Cáceres Tello" subtitle: "Academic Portfolio" format: html: include-in-header: text: | theme: cosmo toc: true toc-title: "Contents" toc-location: left number-sections: false page-layout: full allow-html: true engine: knitr execute: echo: false warning: false message: false freeze: auto --- # 👨‍🏫 About
**Jesús Cáceres Tello** is a computer scientist and educator with extensive experience in ICT, higher education, and applied research in environmental informatics and educational innovation. He holds a **Diploma in Computer Science** from the University of Málaga, a **B.Sc. in Computer Engineering** from the Catholic University of Ávila, and a **Master’s degree in Educational Informatics** from the University of Alcalá. He is currently pursuing his **Ph.D. at the Faculty of Statistical Studies, Complutense University of Madrid**. Throughout his professional career, Jesús has held several positions of responsibility in public institutions. At the **University of Alcalá**, he led the design, maintenance, and digital identity of the university’s web platforms. At the **Carlos III Health Institute**, he contributed to European projects on **Electronic Health Records (EHR)**, **semantic interoperability**, and **telemedicine** under ISO 13606 and ISO 21090 standards. He also worked at the **Spanish Ministry of Education** developing national e-learning platforms. Since 2014, he has served at the **Madrid City Council**, leading technological projects and training initiatives within the Environmental Department. Jesús has been a **lecturer for more than a decade**, teaching at both undergraduate and master’s levels. He is currently part of academic innovation groups promoting open and collaborative learning and a member of the **ACM Spain SIGCSE Chapter** and the **EN13606 Association**. His current interests combine **technology, sustainability, and education**, fostering **data-driven innovation** and **scientific literacy** in the digital era.
--- # 🔬 Research & Teaching Areas - 🌍 Environmental data modelling and air quality forecasting - 🤖 Machine learning and hybrid predictive models (Prophet–LSTM, GAT–BiLSTM) - 🧠 Quantum computing for education - 🧩 STEM education and open pedagogy - 📈 Open science and reproducible research - 🪶 Data visualisation and scientific communication --- # 📚 Publications & Open Repositories
